mainClaim: Government regulation of social media content threatens free speech and innovation more than it protects users
evidence: Analysis of EU's Digital Services Act implementation shows 34% increase in content removal, with 41% of removals later deemed incorrect. Smaller platforms face $2.1M average compliance costs, cementing Big Tech monopolies. India's IT Rules 2021 led to government-ordered takedowns of political criticism and journalism. Regulatory capture risk is high - large platforms can afford compliance, startups cannot.
supportingPoints: Content moderation at scale with 100% accuracy is technically impossible
Regulatory definitions of 'harmful content' are vague and politically manipulable
Encryption backdoors required by some proposals compromise all user security
Competition and user choice more effective than government mandates
limitations: Acknowledges harms exist but questions regulatory solutions. Doesn't fully address child safety concerns. May underweight coordination problems requiring collective action. Alternative solutions not fully developed.
